programme.desc: A championship 50 years in the making for the Kansas City Chiefs. Super Bowl MVP Patrick Mahomes leads the Chiefs to 21 straight points in the final 6:13 for a 31-20 victory over the San Francisco 49ers. From Feb. 2, 2020.

programme.desc: The Chiefs cement their dynasty with a game winning overtime walk-off touchdown pass from Patrick Mahomes to Mecole Hardman. Kansas City wins back-to-back Super Bowls by defeating the 49ers 25-22 in Super Bowl LVIII.

programme.desc: Featherweight contender Mauricio Lara was back in action, facing Jose Sanmartin in Mexico City.

programme.desc: Undisputed lightweight champion Katie Taylor (19-0) clashed with Firuza Sharipova (14-1) at Liverpool.

programme.title: Mayweather vs. De La Hoya (2007)
programme.desc: Two of boxings biggest names finally met in the ring, as Floyd Mayweather Jr. challenged Oscar De La Hoya.

programme.title: Mayweather vs. Hatton (2007)
programme.desc: Floyd Mayweather Jr. returned to welterweight to go up against Britains Ricky Hatton.

programme.title: Pacquiao vs. De La Hoya (2008)
programme.desc: Oscar De La Hoya brought the curtain down on his illustrious career in the ring with a mouth-watering bout.

programme.title: De La Hoya vs. Vargas (2002)
programme.desc: Oscar De La Hoya faced Fernando Vargas in Las Vegas for the WBC, WBA and lineal junior-middleweight titles.

programme.title: De La Hoya vs. Hopkins (2004)
programme.desc: Oscar De La Hoya and Bernard The Executioner Hopkins fought to become undisputed middleweight champion.

programme.desc: Brad Lidge closed out the Rays and a perfect season as Harry Kalas declared "The Philadelphia Phillies are 2008 World Champions of baseball".

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: In a historic victory, the Yankees secure their 27th World Series title, propelled by Hideki Matsui's legendary performance. His six runs driven in, a World Series record, almost single handedly beat the Phillies, propelling New York to a 7-3 win.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Giants defeat the Rangers to win their first World Series championship since 1954.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2011 matchup between the Cardinals and the Rangers. After being down to their last out twice in Game 6, St. Louis walked it off in extras and went on to win Game 7, securing the team's 11th World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The San Francisco Giants swept Justin Verlander, Miguel Cabrera and the Detroit Tigers to win their second World Series championship in three seasons.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Boston Red Sox dispatch the St. Louis Cardinals in six games to earn their third World Series championship in 10 seasons.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Jeremy take a first-generation Scout apart and put an all-new chassis, drive train and 4-link suspension underneath.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Most convertible tops from the late 60's, early 70's have problems; the AGG crew will demonstrate how to replace and rebuild a convertible top from top to bottom.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Deciding whether fix a problem engine or throw in a new one; a 355 Crate engine for a '33 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou prove a diesel sedan delivers massive power; Lou fabricates an intercooler and a larger turbo on a vintage Mercedes 300D, while Jared takes a BMW 335D and adds an ECU upgrade with turbos.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Reviewing 50 years of the iconic Chevrolet Camaro, from the prototype Camaro No. 1 to the 2017 COPO Camaro.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Jeepster project is back, and Ian wants to focus on some of the drivetrain components; he pulls out a 3.5-liter Ecoboost engine and a 6-R-80 transmission from a Ford Expedition to help the old Jeep drive like a more modern one.

programme.title: All Girls Garage

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1959 Ford Edsel and take out the stock transmission to put in an automatic overdrive and give the classic car extra shifting power.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a very clean '69 fastback Mustang; the owner has added extra power under the hood, Bryan and Jeremy need to upgrade the rear end with a Posi unit; they also upgrade the transmission to give the owner a few extra gears.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian doesn't like spending money on new trucks, so he just builds what he wants; today, he starts working on a custom frame to sit under a classic Jeepster Commando and outfits the suspension, along with getting new one-ton axles underneath.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Jeremy take a first-generation Scout apart and put an all-new chassis, drive train and 4-link suspension underneath.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Most convertible tops from the late 60's, early 70's have problems; the AGG crew will demonstrate how to replace and rebuild a convertible top from top to bottom.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Deciding whether fix a problem engine or throw in a new one; a 355 Crate engine for a '33 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou prove a diesel sedan delivers massive power; Lou fabricates an intercooler and a larger turbo on a vintage Mercedes 300D, while Jared takes a BMW 335D and adds an ECU upgrade with turbos.

programme.desc: Reviewing 50 years of the iconic Chevrolet Camaro, from the prototype Camaro No. 1 to the 2017 COPO Camaro.

programme.desc: Derek teams up with Dave Chappelle to revitalize a 1972 Jeep J2000 that's sat among a field of neglected Jeeps; together, they cobble together parts from various Jeeps to get theirs running and attempt to make the 100-mile journey to Derek's shop.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: For years, Pigpen, the junkyard rescued 1950 GMC truck, has sat dormant; the guys awaken a monster by donating the chassis of their own legendary 1985 S-15 in a body swap for the ages, then take on Randy Pobst at Atlanta Motor Speedway.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A good customer brings a troubled 1965 Ford Mustang into the shop; Noah and the crew attempt to restore life to a 1965 Cobra that is not running.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: What was supposed to be an unfinished project feels more like a mechanic special; with problem after problem, it looks like this car was closer to ending up in a landfill than laying down 11s leaving the car meet.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Iconic cars go against one another in a battle for bragging rights.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Super Turbo Story Time
programme.desc: Every so often a visionary comes along, and with their imagination, grit and perseverance, they manage to fail and leave a mark on automotive history.

programme.title: Super Turbo Story Time
programme.desc: Rob Corddry and Emelia Harford tell two stories of Japanese visionaries who managed to bring their visions to life and change the car world, despite obstacles.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnante travels to Maricopa, Ariz., to uncover a Sputnik-inspired '60 Lincoln Continental Mark V, a Funny-Car-waiting-to-happen '64 Mercury Comet Caliente, a rare aluminum-block Rambler and a resto-ready '65 Plymouth Sport Fury Convertible.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnante discovers a '61 Chevy Impala bubble top, '69 Dodge Super Bee, four-speed '67 Olds 4-4-2 dirt track racer and a one-of-only-617 '69 Mercury Cyclone Spoiler Cale Yarborough Special in a unique Georgia junkyard with a no-crush policy.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: A 1966 Chevy Impala convertible gets a full makeover, with new paint, motor, interior and top, plus a ton of rust repair; the previous owner was forced to sell it to cover health bills, but now his wife and son want him to have his prized car back.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: One thousand horsepower is all too common these days and all too accessible. With these numbers well within reach, it's time we looked into two ways to get there: a supercharger on a medium-sized mill; and natural aspiration atop large-displacement.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: As a longtime promoter of tunnel rams, Freiburger is often asked about running a four-barrel carb vs dual quads on the tunnel ram; he answers with a setup for guys who are all about the look and presence of the tunnel ram.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with his brother Sean to convert a 1966 Oldsmobile F-85 from a wannabe drag racer into a timeless cruiser; it'll take more than a paint job to make this car street-able, as the guys discover the engine is keeping a horrible secret.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys convert their motorcycle-engine-powered '72 Honda Z600 coupe named Bozo into a micro sprint-inspired dirt-track ripper; pro driver Taylor Reimer sets the bar in her 400-hp 1,000-plus-pound Toyota.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Discovering how a wet system stacks up against a dry system in an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: Return of the Gunfighter
programme.desc: Ben Wyatt (Robert Taylor) is an aging gunfighter who has grown weary of his lifestyle. But when an old friend, Luis (Rodolfo Hoyos Jr.), asks for help defending his land, Ben can't say no. Unfortunately, he arrives too late, finding Luis and his entire family -- except daughter Anisa (Ana Martn) -- murdered. Ben is determined to get revenge against the killers, and in pursuing them reluctantly enlists the aid a younger gunfighter, Lee Sutton (Chad Everett).

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: An old cowboy returns to visit Ricky and Sandy and help them round up a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: A down-on-luck prospector and spinner of tall tales helps Ricky capture a gang of rustlers.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: A young ranch hand is saved from joining the wrong crowd when Ricky needs his help.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Ricky and Sandy try to prevent a gullible general store owner from being fleeced by a couple of con men trying to sell a salted mine.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Sandy investigates Ricky's wild tale of a medicine show operator who he saw stuff a small boy into a box. The Norths learn that Doc Terwilliger, the show's owner, is a ventriloquist.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: The worst drought in 20 years has struck the valley where the Norths have their ranch. Champion searches for a waterhole for his herd of wild horses.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: An elderly prospector searching for gold finally strikes paydirt, but before he can file a claim, he is killed by a pair of drifters who stampede a wild horse herd over the man's body.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: During a shootout, Hode is killed and Jett vows to take his revenge on Hollister for his death.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A new bank opens and Banker Hamilton hires a slow-witted gunman to guard the safe. When some of the gunman's old outlaw friends arrive in town they propose he join them in robbing the bank.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: After receiving an urgent telegram from an old flame, Yancy returns to New Orleans only to discover that his family plantation, Waverly, has been turned into a gambling den. Aside from being pursued by some angry gamblers, Yancy learns John Colton, the City Administrator of New Orleans, wants to make a deal with him to reconstruct the plantation.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer

However, Yancy hides an explosive trick up his sleeve - the tiny, noble sea captain of a ship crammed with the latest invention from Sweden. Backing up the unlikely duo is the silent, lethal Pahoo.

programme.desc: Bill tries to help a young woman who is being pursued by two men.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Bleak House in Broadstairs, where sisters Nina and Nicola Hilton have `Great Expectations' of success and the guests are blown away by a Dickens discovery.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Torquay and owners Mark and Jo Warden hope their four-star establishment, The Cimon, has what it takes to win.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cardinal's Hat in Worcester where owner Nigel Smith, who has more than 30 years of experience in hospitality, likes the finer things in life.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to Cledan Valley in Mid Wales, where husband and wife duo Russ and Karen Colman hope their glamping site will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Springfield House in Instow, Devon, where Lucinda Renshaw, who is joined in the competition by friend Diane Passmore, transformed this home in to a B&B eight years ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Huddersfield, where John Whitworth hopes the unique style of The Edge Accommodation has enough personality to win over his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Darwin Lake Holiday Village in Matlock, managed by best friends Sally McAnulty and Teresa Shirley, who take pride in their exclusive village feel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group head to Sands Resort Hotel and Spa in Newquay, where father-and-son team Nicholas and Tom Malcolm pride themselves on the vast facilities they have on offer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Oak Tree Lane Yurt Site in Bratton Clovelly, Devon, where owner Phil Gilbert is taking things back to basics. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the Mongolian yurts.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Church Street Cobbles in Macclesfield, where foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened a B&B above a barber shop.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock and roll venue The Vic Bikers pub in Leicestershire where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On day three, Steve and Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests at The Cranberries Hideaway in Devon.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi hope to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Helmsley North Yorkshire at Laskill Country House, where straight-talking farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and friend Anny Harrison run a tight ship.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Swan Hotel in Telford owned by Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy. They are hoping straightforward value for money will win them the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire where Colin Warburg, along with student son Ben, hope their 81 room country pile will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the competition this week is to The Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fiance Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and dcor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first day of this competition is at the Blackthorn Farm B&B on Anglesey, Wales, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week. On arrival, Dan and Rachel Lonergan take in the view, and Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor are feeling the vibes for their morning meditation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Graham and Barbara Yellow pride themselves on offering basic facilities for great value for money at the White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch find some hairs out of place in their room, while spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from being in room number four. Over dinner, Graham and Barbara relax into their roles, leaving Rachel Lonergan feeling guilty about having labelled them as game players.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor have an alternative approach to their business at The Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch think it will be a wigwam, while Rachel and Dan Lonergan are expecting a commune.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Inn, B&B newcomers Rachel and Dan Lonergan want to offer a luxury, boutique experience for their guests. After getting negative feedback on the last visit, Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor go on the offensive.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Features the Union Inn in Cowes, the Shoreside Inn in Shanklin, Raj's Kirribilli Guesthouse in Newquay, and the Elysian Fields B&B in Helston.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Biggest Loser US

programme.desc: This weeks theme is I Lack Self Control.

programme.desc: All contestants return to reveal their incredible transformations live on stage.

programme.desc: The remaining six junior home cooks receive a special invitation to Gordons home for their next team challenge. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Autistic gardener Alan Gardner returns, launching himself into suburbia with some ingenious designs. This time he has 10,000 to transform a desolate Lancashire plot.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Autistic gardener Alan Gardner travels to Bristol, where Ig, Joe and their three kids need help with their 100 foot garden, that's currently overflowing with weeds and waste.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Josh Greer are fishing for south Floridas exotics amongst the alligators of the Florida Everglades.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss shares the skiff with the creator of D.O.A. Lures, Capt. Mark Nichols, in Stuart, Florida.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing one of his favorite Central Florida Lakes for Largemouth Bass!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Chris Shultz head offshore out of Mayport, Florida in search of massive Red Snapper!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Petersons Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's time in Argentina is winding down and he needs just one more species before moving on to Peru: the Brazilian Teal. The guides have seen a few in the area so Mark and his crew try some new tactics, hoping to close in on the 13th and final species on this leg of the journey.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson persists in his pursuit of the North American Deer Slam, setting his sights on Kentucky as his next destination with his focus on the Southeastern Whitetail. Unsurprisingly, he has chosen Kentucky due to his wealth of experience and cherished memories from previous hunts in the area making the decision effortless. Venturing down for late muzzleloader season, he keenly anticipates the convergence of a high-pressure system, hoping to position himself in the perfect spot at the opportune moment.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week, Mark Peterson is in Oregon chasing the Columbia Whitetail. Found in only two counties of Oregon, the Columbia Whitetail is one of the most sought-after deer species. The first day posed its challenges with heavy fog at daybreak, but Mark and his guide Rob kept the pursuit for a big Columbia Whitetail. After putting on many miles throughout the morning, the fog began to lift and they finally laid eyes on their target buck. Moving into position had its challenges with plenty of satellite deer around, but in the end it came together. As an added bonus, Marks buck is the new Muzzleloader world record Columbia Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.desc: Catch all of the deer that have hit the dirt over the last few seasons on The Raven right here.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: In this episode, Brian is fishing with his new SMH jig heads and worms.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Watch along as Brian hosts a little shootout between the next generation of anglers and himself. This is certainly an episode you will not want to miss!

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Brian and The Colonel kick it old school and break out the Carolina rig. The Colonel hopes to put Brian on a big bag while fishing his home waters, Lake Toho.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Check out part two of Brian's first-ever teen shootout.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Get ready for an adrenaline-pumping fishing adventure like no other as we dive into the sun-drenched waters of Florida with the revolutionary new Z-Man Gremlin Bait!

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Welcome to the Flint river, where treacherous bedrock and shoals are habitat for some of the meanest bass that Swim. Brian meets up with MLF Rookie Flint Davis to catch shoalies in the Off-Season.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxlers life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. Well take a look into Nikkis life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. Well also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Macks Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. Well even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Macks employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. Its timber holes and tall tales. Its cups of coffee and cupped up wings. Its partners in business, and partners in potholes and its pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode well tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, well head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. Well talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. Well also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site well chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, well learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, well tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In this inaugural episode, host Ryan McVinney takes viewers to the outer reaches of Cape Cod, Massachusetts to meet a local group of boaters affectionately referred to as the The Tin Boat Mafia. This heart-warming family story of aluminum boat owners who share a love for the outdoors and nature is particularly moving during the COVID-19 pandemic. From fishing and surfing to sun bathing and collecting driftwood, this episode chronicles the groups passion for the water and demonstrates why light-weight, easy-to-handle, shallow draft aluminum fishing boats are their vessels of choice for navigating the sandbars of Cape Cod, MA.

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well Often their play time happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why dont we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girls hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: The Journey Within

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.desc: Well-known for producing some of the highest quality firearms for more than a century, the Browning X-Bolt can lift the average Joe hunter to the level of dead-eye marksman. To showcase how simple it can be, self-proclaimed average hunter Brandon Bates takes a brand new Browning X-Bolt right out of the box and goes to the range to see what this production rifle can do in custom rifle scenarios.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads out ice fishing with some friends, looking to teach musky angler Megan Patterson how to tackle these picky panfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.desc: *Part 2* Zach and Carson Wentz hunt the early season in Kentucky hoping to catch up with velvet bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Stalk the hills of Utah in search of mule deer as natures most scenic canvases go on full display.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired Sgt. of the Dallas Forth Worth Police department, Rachel Dehoyos, reflects back on her career as she participates in a Texas hunt that she won, hosted by Record Rack Deer Feed.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is in Columbia, South Carolina, fishing with Captain Justin McGrady for the elusive freshwater Striped Bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Josh Greer are fishing for south Floridas exotics amongst the alligators of the Florida Everglades.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss shares the skiff with the creator of D.O.A. Lures, Capt. Mark Nichols, in Stuart, Florida.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing one of his favorite Central Florida Lakes for Largemouth Bass!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Chris Shultz head offshore out of Mayport, Florida in search of massive Red Snapper!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Petersons Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's time in Argentina is winding down and he needs just one more species before moving on to Peru: the Brazilian Teal. The guides have seen a few in the area so Mark and his crew try some new tactics, hoping to close in on the 13th and final species on this leg of the journey.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson persists in his pursuit of the North American Deer Slam, setting his sights on Kentucky as his next destination with his focus on the Southeastern Whitetail. Unsurprisingly, he has chosen Kentucky due to his wealth of experience and cherished memories from previous hunts in the area making the decision effortless. Venturing down for late muzzleloader season, he keenly anticipates the convergence of a high-pressure system, hoping to position himself in the perfect spot at the opportune moment.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week, Mark Peterson is in Oregon chasing the Columbia Whitetail. Found in only two counties of Oregon, the Columbia Whitetail is one of the most sought-after deer species. The first day posed its challenges with heavy fog at daybreak, but Mark and his guide Rob kept the pursuit for a big Columbia Whitetail. After putting on many miles throughout the morning, the fog began to lift and they finally laid eyes on their target buck. Moving into position had its challenges with plenty of satellite deer around, but in the end it came together. As an added bonus, Marks buck is the new Muzzleloader world record Columbia Whitetail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryans son his first bird.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father, Earl, travel down to the great state of Kansas in hops to knock another quail species off their list. The North American Bobwhite Quail hold very tight and fly spastically from their covey. River bottoms and thick grasslands are the habitat of choice of these fast fliers. A river crossing and a broken up covey allow Mark to check the Bobwhite Quail off his list. Only a few species left to complete the Journey Within - A bird Hunters Diary!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Its the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Dj vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project - "Raven Whitetails"
programme.desc: Catch all of the deer that have hit the dirt over the last few seasons on The Raven right here.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldnt be right if we didnt try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With the King of the Raven in full swing, Randy decides to have a doe challenge to close out the season. With a bunch of buddies coming into camp this next week is about to be full of Surprises.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: In this episode, Brian is fishing with his new SMH jig heads and worms.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Watch along as Brian hosts a little shootout between the next generation of anglers and himself. This is certainly an episode you will not want to miss!

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Brian and The Colonel kick it old school and break out the Carolina rig. The Colonel hopes to put Brian on a big bag while fishing his home waters, Lake Toho.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Check out part two of Brian's first-ever teen shootout.

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Get ready for an adrenaline-pumping fishing adventure like no other as we dive into the sun-drenched waters of Florida with the revolutionary new Z-Man Gremlin Bait!

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing
programme.desc: Welcome to the Flint river, where treacherous bedrock and shoals are habitat for some of the meanest bass that Swim. Brian meets up with MLF Rookie Flint Davis to catch shoalies in the Off-Season.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxlers life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. Well take a look into Nikkis life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. Well also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Macks Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. Well even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Macks employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. Its timber holes and tall tales. Its cups of coffee and cupped up wings. Its partners in business, and partners in potholes and its pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode well tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, well head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. Well talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. Well also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site well chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, well learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, well tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes on a Lionfish Hunt that takes him to some of the most beautiful reefs in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In this inaugural episode, host Ryan McVinney takes viewers to the outer reaches of Cape Cod, Massachusetts to meet a local group of boaters affectionately referred to as the The Tin Boat Mafia. This heart-warming family story of aluminum boat owners who share a love for the outdoors and nature is particularly moving during the COVID-19 pandemic. From fishing and surfing to sun bathing and collecting driftwood, this episode chronicles the groups passion for the water and demonstrates why light-weight, easy-to-handle, shallow draft aluminum fishing boats are their vessels of choice for navigating the sandbars of Cape Cod, MA.

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well Often their play time happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why dont we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girls hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: The Journey Within

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
